title: Induced emf - rectangular loop entering field

content.question: A uniform magnetic field <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math> is directed out of the page, as shown in the figure. A loop of wire of area <math alttext="0.4 meter squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math> is in the plane of the page. At time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, the field has a magnitude <math alttext="3.0 teslas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi></math> and is decreasing at the rate of <math alttext="0.5 tesla per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>T/s</mtext></math>. What is the magnitude of the induced <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>emf</mtext></math> in the wire at time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="0.2 volt" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>
<math alttext="0.6 volt" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.6</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>
<math alttext="0.8 volt" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.8</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>
<math alttext="1.2 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="0.2 volt" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
